Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bank

  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of Bank class is to add an account of either Savings or Chequing to the Bank. Displays one account separately or all accounts in the Bank at once. Updates accounts with either deposit or withdraw transactions.
    Since:
    JDK 1.8
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Patrick Czermak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bank()
      Constructor which initializes maxSize variable to 1000, and BankAccount ArrayList to the size of maxSize.
      Bank(int maxSize)
      Parameterized Constructor which defines the Bank to have a maxSize.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addAccount()
      Method addAccount adds either a Savings or Chequing account to the @accounts ArrayList.
      void displayAccount()
      Method displayAccount displays account information through calling findAccount() method in current class.
      int findAccount()
      Method findAccount validates user inputed account number.
      static int findAccount(int accountNumber)
      Method static findAccount(int accountNumber) is overloaded which takes input instead of asking for it.
      void monthlyUpdate()
      Method monthlyUpdate updates all accounts in the @accounts array.
      void printAccountDetails()
      Method printAccountDetails prints all accounts in @accounts ArrayList, utilizes the toString() method to ensure proper account information is printed for each account.
      void updateAccount()
      Method updateAccount performs either deposit or withdraws on the specified account based on if user enters a positive or negative number (positive for deposit, negative for withdraw).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bank

        public Bank()
        Constructor which initializes maxSize variable to 1000, and BankAccount ArrayList to the size of maxSize.

      • Bank

        public Bank(int maxSize)
        Parameterized Constructor which defines the Bank to have a maxSize.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - holds the maximum size of accounts that the bank can hold.

    • Method Detail

      • addAccount

        public boolean addAccount()
        Method addAccount adds either a Savings or Chequing account to the @accounts ArrayList.
        Returns:
        true when accounts have been properly initialized as either Savings or Chequing.

      • displayAccount

        public void displayAccount()
        Method displayAccount displays account information through calling findAccount() method in current class. Checks first to make sure @accounts ArrayList index isn't negative or prints an error.

      • printAccountDetails

        public void printAccountDetails()
        Method printAccountDetails prints all accounts in @accounts ArrayList, utilizes the toString() method to ensure proper account information is printed for each account.

      • updateAccount

        public void updateAccount()
        Method updateAccount performs either deposit or withdraws on the specified account based on if user enters a positive or negative number (positive for deposit, negative for withdraw).

      • findAccount

        public int findAccount()
        Method findAccount validates user inputed account number.
        Returns:
        Bank.findAccount(accountNumber) where findAccount(accountNumber) is validated for uniqueness.

      • findAccount

        public static int findAccount(int accountNumber)
        Method static findAccount(int accountNumber) is overloaded which takes input instead of asking for it. Used when adding a new account.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - a specific account number in the @accounts array.
        Returns:
        -1 or the index of the account

      • monthlyUpdate

        public void monthlyUpdate()
        Method monthlyUpdate updates all accounts in the @accounts array.
